name: CAP Theorem 23 Years Later with Eric Brewer - Software Engineering Daily
summary: The CAP theorem, also known as Brewerâ€™s theorem, is a fundamental principle in distributed systems that states that it is impossible to simultaneously achieve three desirable properties in a distributed data system: Consistency, Availability, and Partition tolerance. Eric Brewer is the VP of Infrastructure & Google Fellow at Google and he joins us today. This
